forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 49. North northwest wind around 3 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. Northwest wind around 6 mph.

weather_report:
As the night gently gives way to dawn, Downtown San Francisco reveals itself in the soft embrace of twilight. The air is cool and still, with a refreshing hint of clarity that promises a lovely day ahead. Particularly for those who appreciate the subtle beauty of winter mornings, the current chill lingers at a comfortable 49 degrees, inviting a light jacket to ward off the coolness. 

The forecast promises a shift to a mostly sunny disposition by midday, with temperatures expected to peak at around 61, then gracefully settling back to the mid-fifties as the afternoon wind begins to whisper through the streets. Those venturing out will find it wise to layer—perhaps a warm sweater beneath a light coat for the morning, shedding the outer layer to enjoy the sun later on. As for activities, consider a leisurely stroll along one of the quieter neighborhoods; the early hours of a Saturday morning beckon with the promise of freshly brewed coffee from a nearby café, or perhaps a solitary visit to the local bookstore. Seek out those serene moments where the city’s heartbeat slows, allowing you to tune into the whispers of everyday life before the hustle fully awakens.
